name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Memphis Germantown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here because it was near the I-40 and took pets; also there was ample parking for a large moving truck. Room smelled musty and had very 1980's decorations; since I'd just stayed in a lovely new Staybridge the night before, I was considerably unimpressed, since both chains have the same model, but the Staybridge was clean and new, and this one was in need of an update.
reviews.title: Not too exciting
Good Value - espcially with free dinner and breakfast
reviews.text: Dogs were accepted and happy. Staff was unimpressive and unmemorable. Breakfast was ok but not great.

No complaints! This hotel is great for any type of traveler, especially if you're looking for some free meals. The breakfast buffet was very good. It comes with free dinners - nothing special (I think they had chicken fingers the night I stayed there). But I recommend one of the local BBQ establishments for lunch or dinner - Corky's is nearby and excellent. This hotel is also great for runners or walkers. There are many parks and walking trails nearby, which is nice since the workout room in the hotel was very subpar. The rooms were large and clean and good access to free wireless - I'd definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice stay at Homewood Suites

likes.liked: — Suite set up, breakfast included in price

reviews.title: Like a little apartment
reviews.text: We stayed at Homewood Suites Germantown for three nights while in town to see UCF play in the Liberty Bowl.

There were four of us in the one bedroom suite and there was plenty of room for all of us. There was a king sized bed in the bedroom, with a sleeper sofa in the living room for the boys. It was nice to have a good sized refrigerator in the kitchen, rather than a mini-fridge like there is at most hotels. Another good feature was that the bathtub and toilet were in one room and the sink/vanity area was in the space between the bathroom and the bedroom, allowing more than one person to get ready at the same time. There was a very good hairdryer mounted on the wall near the sink.
reviews.title: Overpriced and smelled like wet carpet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're just here for one night, passing through-and wish we had planned to stay longer.
reviews.title: Brand New-Beautiful and Clean!

reviews.text: Wow! Granite countertops in the kitchen and bath.
reviews.title: Excellent
Home Away From Home in Memphis
reviews.text: We've stayed at Rtiz Carltons that arent' this nice and clean.
Our baseball team stayed at the Homewood for 6 nights.
reviews.title: great hotel home from home

reviews.text: This hotel is in the perfect location to everything.The room is really a nice size,clean and it's nice to have a full kitchen. I was really suprised dinner was offered each night for free. I love the Homewood its cozy and it feels like yoyr at a retreat and not a hotel.Try not to get a room next to the lobby and pool. I'ts a little noisy at night.
reviews.title: nice place to stay...

reviews.text: I stayed at the Homewood Suites, Germantown, after finding that my preferred Homewood Suites (Hacks Crossing) was full. This was my first stay at the Germantown location.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay at the Homewood Suites, Germantown, TN

reviews.text: I am happy to report that this hotel met my expectations. It was an extremely clean facility, both interior and exterior, and the staff was exceptionally friendly. The property is a little misplaced (i.e., away from major business centers), but that was okay - it was nice not hearing road traffic all night!
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: It seems like I am growing more fond of Hilton's Homewood Suites. I like the small details that they provide, such as the evening Manager's brunch and the ceiling fan above the bed. I have stayed at a lot of their properties and I have yet to be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: I am always looking for nicer pet friendly hotels to stay at that are still affordable. I was very pleased with this hotel, the rooms were fairly large, clean, and comfortable. The staff was also very helpful.
reviews.title: Hotel is NOT New, if this is the best of Germantown, don't stay in Germantown

reviews.text: Upon turning down the bed, was greeted by human hair of at least two different individuals. The bathtub had streaks of grit. Sheets were polyester. I slept on towels for reasons of both cleanliness and comfort. Also put a towel in the bathtub before showering so I wouldn't have to stand on the dirty tub surface. This hotel needs some serious attention to room preparation.
reviews.title: Hygenically challenged

aka: Homewood Suites By Hilton Memphis Germantown Hotel
description: Homewood Suites by Hilton® allows you to feel closer to home whether you're traveling for a few nights or longer. Every spacious suite features enough space for work, study or entertaining, plus all the comforts of home, including a fully equipped kitchen with a full-size refrigerator, coffee-maker and microwave oven, and television. You'll also enjoy a complimentary hot breakfast every morning and an evening Manager's Reception with a complimentary light meal and beverages every Monday-Thursday. All for less than you might think.
